org.jawin
Class Variant.ByrefHolder

java.lang.Object
  org.jawin.Variant.ByrefHolder
Enclosing class:
Variant
public static class Variant.ByrefHolder
extends java.lang.Object

placeholder class for VT_BYREF objects (mostly [out] or [in, out]-parameters). Any object that should be marshalled as a VT_BYREF|*-type should be wrapped in a ByrefHolder-object before being passed to writeObject().

If one of the DispatchPtr.invoke() methods are used, the result will automatically be marshalled into the ByrefHolder object when the invoke call returns. The caller could then retrive the result by calling getRef().

Version:
$Revision: 1.9 $
Author:
Morten Andersen, arosii_moa (at) users.sourceforge.net

Constructor Detail

Variant.ByrefHolder

public Variant.ByrefHolder(java.lang.Object ref)
construct a ByrefHolder holding a reference to the ref object. Please notice that to be marshalled into the correct VT-type, one must supply an object of the correct type (even if it is only an [out]-parameter).

Eg. if calling a method with a signature like: 
	[out]SAFEARRAY(int) *pLongArray
one should create a ByrefHolder like: 
	ByrefHolder holder = new ByrefHolder(new int[0]);

Parameters:
ref - the object to marshal as a VT_BYREF|*-type. If null the ByrefHolder will be marshalled as VT_NULL.
Method Detail

getRef

public java.lang.Object getRef()
return the referenced object.

setRef

public void setRef(java.lang.Object ref)
set the referenced object.
